title: Cinesound Review No. 0495 [excerpt]: the mere male supplanted
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945 - Australia
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Women - Australia
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Women - Australia
abstract: This newsreel excerpt highlights women playing traditional male sports during World War II when many of the men who usually dominated these arenas were fighting overseas.
description: This tongue-in-cheek newsreel excerpt features female sports people participating  in sports that were previously only the domain of men, during the Second World War while many Australian men were absent in the theatres of war. Some of the sports included horse riding, cycling and surf life saving. The narration illustrates the cultural attitudes of the time in the way the women are described and their physical attributes dwelt upon. Courtesy Cinesound Movietone Productions.
